text:
Fans prepare to pack P&L, Kauffman Stadium for Game 1 Posted: Lisa.D'Souza@kctv5.com KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - 
Royals fans say if you can't be at Kauffman Stadium, the Power and Light District is a close second. 
Thursday night, a sea of blue poured into the district; some fans scoped out their spot in front of the screen as early as 2 p.m. 
"The atmosphere. Last year the atmosphere was so awesome," David Henson said. "Everybody had fun." 
One bar, McFadden's, is quickly becoming a hot after party spot for the Royals players, too. The tradition started after a rain-out game last season. 
"A couple of our favorite guys came down here and just naturally created friendships that we'll have forever," General Manager Mike Ferger said. 
McFadden's has its own pregame tradition, too. Before a game, managers will pour a bottle of blue liquid into the district's fountain for good luck. 
"We realized the centerpiece of our live block wasn't blue," Ferger said. "So we made our special potion, our Royal blue potion and dumped it in there. And they won. And they advanced."
